meanings.definition: Make (someone) aware of a particular issue or situation.
meanings.sent1: She sensitized her friend to the importance of recycling.
meanings.sent2: The workshop sensitized the participants to the dangers of cyberbullying.
meanings.sent3: He sensitized his cat to the sound of the treat bag, making it come running every time.
meanings.sent4: The experience sensitized her to the struggles of those less fortunate.
meanings.sent5: The documentary sensitized viewers to the impact of climate change on wildlife.

meanings.definition: Make (something) sensitive or responsive to external stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The new camera technology sensitized the device to even the slightest movements.
meanings.sent2: The skin cream sensitized her face to the sun, causing a slight redness.
meanings.sent3: The scientist sensitized the plant to light, making it bloom faster than usual.
meanings.sent4: The training sensitized her taste buds to appreciate the subtle flavors of the dish.
meanings.sent5: The therapy sensitized his hearing, allowing him to detect faint sounds he couldn't hear before.
